intro: Pavetta gorontalensis, commonly known as the Gorontalensis pavetta, is a flowering plant species native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with opposite, elliptical leaves that are usually glossy in appearance. Its small, white or pale pink flowers are clustered in cymes and are often accompanied by prominent bracts. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds, aiding in wind dispersal.
